# Exceptions Docs

## Exceptions and errors

- [Overview](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/fundamentals/exceptions/index.md): Learn about exceptions and exception handling. These C# features help deal with unexpected or exceptional situations that happen when a program is running.
- [Using exceptions](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/fundamentals/exceptions/using-exceptions.md): Learn how to use exceptions. Exceptions are thrown by code that encounters an error and caught by code that corrects the error.
- [Exception handling](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/fundamentals/exceptions/exception-handling.md): Learn about exception handling. See examples of try-catch, try-finally, and try-catch-finally statements.
- [Creating and throwing exceptions](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/fundamentals/exceptions/creating-and-throwing-exceptions.md): Learn about creating and throwing exceptions. Exceptions are used to indicate that an error has occurred while running a program.
- [Compiler-generated exceptions](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/fundamentals/exceptions/compiler-generated-exceptions.md): Learn about compiler-generated exceptions. Review a list of automatically thrown exceptions and their error conditions.

## Tutorials

- [How to handle an exception using try-catch](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/fundamentals/exceptions/how-to-handle-an-exception-using-try-catch.md): Learn how to handle an exception using a try-catch block. See a code example and view additional available resources.
- [How to execute cleanup code using finally](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/csharp/fundamentals/exceptions/how-to-execute-cleanup-code-using-finally.md): Learn how to execute cleanup code using a 'finally' statement. Finally statements ensure that any necessary cleanup of objects occurs immediately.
